page.title: 14Arran & Shiskine Transport
page.content: {Boat}We depend on the car ferry, MV Isle of Arran for many things, such as food, drink, cars, machinery etc.It is our most important form of transport as it is our{only link with the main- {land. {Bus} The bus timetable is very much linked to the ferry timetable. When the boat is late in arriving it can greatly upset the bus times. Far fewer buses run in the winter than in the summer, and only one on Sundays. Buses run children from all round the island, to and from the High School in Lamlash. {Car} Most people on Arran have cars. People need cars to get to the shops, go to the mainland for supplies, or just to get around-they are{essential! {Bike}Lots of people have bikes such as BMX bikes, racers, rally-type, and all sorts of others.
